description: The Streamable is seeking a Video Content Creator to produce and edit various types of videos for our The Streamable's new YouTube channel. We want creators passionate about cord-cutting and streaming. If you want to help millions of cord-cutters learn about the best in streaming services like Netflix, Disney Plus, Hulu and Sling TV, then this freelance opportunity is for you.,We offer the best in news, reviews and deals on streaming services and devices. Our site helps streaming enthusiasts find new services to help them cut the cord on cable, streamline their digital subscriptions and save hundreds a year.,Please visit our site at thestreamable.com to review the content we’ve published. If you’re excited about the content we're creating on The Streamable, we’d love to hear from you.,The creator's responsibilities include brainstorming video ideas, shooting and editing videos, and publishing them to our YouTube channel. You should develop content that helps inform and entertain streaming enthusiast about streaming services and devices.,Please share samples of your video work (portfolio) along with your application. This is a perfect opportunity for a young creator who are eager to hone their video creating skills with an experienced digital team with more than 15 years of experience in the industry as their mentor.,The company is based in San Francisco, but the position can be done from anywhere.,Applicants should include a cover letter, resume and links to several recent portfolio samples.,Only qualified candidates will be contacted for an initial phone interview. Freelancers are responsible for their own invoicing.

description: The Bread Project (TBP), a California not-for-profit organization, believes every person deserves meaningful, productive, and self-sufficient work. Our mission is to empower reentry and justice involved individuals to successfully rejoin society and gain employment by equipping them with food industry and job readiness skills.,For the last 20 years, we have provided workforce development programs for low-income Bay Area residents with multiple barriers to employment. Our programs have equipped individuals with the skills necessary to gain employment in the baking and food industry and start on a path to economic self-sufficiency. Recently, we decided to expand our program from baking only to include more culinary and foodservice preparation training. The new program is 8 weeks and 240 hours in duration, from 9am to 3:30pm Monday through Friday, and focuses solely on the justice involved population, whether they are reentry and on parole, or on probation. During the program, participants earn their CA Food Handlers Card, the entry-level credential necessary to work in commercial kitchens and bakeries, and receive 12 months of job placement support following graduation.,TBP’s current staff is small (4 full-time employees: 1 part-time) and mighty! This highly skilled-team currently seeks to add a dynamic, competent, mission-driven professional as our Program Services Manager.,The overall responsibility of the Program Services Manager is to effectively and efficiently execute the responsibilities and activities required to enroll 60-70 students to fill six cohorts of the training program throughout the fiscal year, and to provide case management liaison services with each student’s parole or probation officer. The Manager acts on behalf of TBP to engage external constituent groups, community partners, and stakeholders as required for fulfilling the responsibilities. Collaboration and communication are essential to the success of this position, especially with colleagues and community and referral agencies to gain support for recruitment. and colleagues. The Manager works with the program team to execute a quality training program for each of the six cohorts each fiscal year, and reports directly to the Executive Director.,The Bread Project is committed to providing equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to their race, color, religious creed, sex, gender identity, gender expression, age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation, height and weight, or other personal characteristics as may be protected by applicable law. All inquiries are held in strict confidence.
